For eighty-one years Social Security has been America at its best, 0, 11
It reflects our shared belief that every American should be able to retire with dignity after decades of hard work, 11, 31
That no American should face poverty because he or she is disabled, 31, 43
That we are stronger together, 43, 48
Social Security benefits 59 million Americans today—but Republicans are relentlessly trying to attack and undermine this bedrock American guarantee
They want to cut benefits and gamble seniors retirement security on the stock market through privatization

And Donald Trump is no different—just look who he chose as his running mate, 83, 97
Mike Pence spent his time in Congress championing efforts to dismantle Social Security—and to privatize it even faster than President George W, 97, 119
Bush and Paul Ryan proposed, 119, 124
We cannot and we will not stand for that
When I served in the Senate I helped lead the fight against the Bush privatization scheme
Instead of cutting or privatizing Social Security we will defend and expand it

When President Roosevelt signed the Social Security Act into law he said it represents a cornerstone in a structure which is being built but is by no means completed, 162, 191
Social Security works but we can make it better, 191, 200
Millions of women—and men—who are widowed or who take time out of the paid workforce to raise a child or care for a sick family member are being left behind, 200, 230
As President Ill expand benefits to cover these hardworking Americans because no one should have to live in poverty because their spouse died or they did the vital work of taking care of a loved one, 230, 266
Social Security isnt just a program—its a promise
And I wont stop fighting until every American shares fully in that promise."
